  • Constructor Details

    • GameSettingsValidator

      public GameSettingsValidator(int initialHeight, int initialWidth, int initialNumMines)
      Constructor to accept initial values for the Validator.
      Parameters:
      initialHeight - Default height on game launch.
      initialWidth - Default width on game launch.
      initialNumMines - Default width on game launch.

  • Method Details

    • updateSettings

      public void updateSettings(int newHeight, int newWidth, int newMines)
      Update game parameters after new settings are validated, so validation text displays properly in menus and new valid ranges are calculated correctly.
      Parameters:
      newHeight - New validated height from updated game settings.
      newWidth - New validated width from updated game settings.
      newMines - New validated mine count from updated game settings.

    • getMinesLimitText

      public String getMinesLimitText()
      Calculate the valid mine range before sending it to the UI.
      Returns:
      String containing UI text and the valid calculated min/max mine count.

    • validate

      public boolean validate(int height, int width, int mines)
      Determine if new user-entered game settings are valid before applying them to a new game.
      Parameters:
      height - New candidate height from game settings.
      width - New candidate height from game settings.
      mines - New candidate mine count from game settings.
      Returns:
      true if the candidate values are within valid game parameters.

    • calcMinMines

      public int calcMinMines(int height, int width, String minOrMax)
      Show the calculation for min/max mine count based on candidate values, so the user knows what values are valid for the new settings.
      Parameters:
      height - Candidate height to be used for the mine count calculation.
      width - Candidate width to be used for the mine count calculation.
      minOrMax - Whether to display the min or max mine count.
      Returns:
      the number of mines which would be considered valid for these candidate grid dimensions.

    • getMinGridSize

      public int getMinGridSize()

    • getMaxGridSize

      public int getMaxGridSize()

    • getMinMaxGridText

      public String getMinMaxGridText()
